Reviews.Title: “The Ultimate Roman Experience!”
Reviews.Author: Bob C
Reviews.Content: Although nondescript on the exterior, inside it's a treasure! During Sept. 2011 we spent two glorious nights in room 210 which overlooks the Pantheon Plaza. The room was incredible, very large, great bed, ornate ceiling, great marble bathroom, sitting area,.......... The arched windows looked out onto the plaza. After a day of touring the major sites which are walking distance and feasting at the great restaurants in the nearby plazas, we retired to our room. There we opened the windows and let the sounds of Rome pour in! Incredible singers took turns at the fountain in our plaza. The quality was incredible. One gentlemen sang Andrea Bocelli's Con te Partiro (time to say goodbye). It was magical. Rome is a romantic city, but, my wife and I found this hotel to be the epitome of romantic. We found all of the staff very helpful. A delicious hot breakfast was served in an open interior courtyard. We travel extensively and this hotel remains one of our favorites. We rarely return to the same place twice since the world is so large with so much to see. But, we plan to return again and again to Rome where we'll stay at this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “No sleep”
Reviews.Author: Erik B Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The temperature in our room was too high to sleep. And when we started the cooling system it made so much noise, that again we could not sleep! The service in the breakfast room was not satisfactory. But otherwise its a charming hotel with a very good location.

Reviews.Title: “Prime location”
Reviews.Author: ladonnacuriosa
Reviews.Content: I've stayed here twice. Once in 1999, and again in 2010. Both were wonderful experiences. Prime location, great staff, gorgeous hotel, and comfortable rooms. Get a room with a view of the Pantheon!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location! Great View!”
Reviews.Author: Dax2012
Reviews.Content: We had the apartment of the hotel (a suite at nr.311, 3e floor), our windowview was on the Pantheon. One point was a minus, the shower, v.v.small and a low pressure on the water. The rest was terrific. I would come back. Great cuisine is Armando al Pantheon, rightside around the corner of the Pantheon, rightside of Pantheon is the Cremeria, small ice-creamshop with the best of the best, for your daily ice-cream. Great is the pizza in La Sagretia (from the hotel, 2 street at your left). Don't go to the Pummarola & drink (on the corner of the Via del Maddalena), it's a tourist-trap. For your daily cappuccino to Pastuccini, Via di Torre Argentina (just around the corner of Feltrinelly). They serviced the best cappuccino. Don't do that in front of the church SantaMaria Maggiore, AnticoCaffe SantaMaria, the 2e touristtrap, especially the prices on the terrace. Wanna sightseeing on budget? Take bus 116, small bus on electra, busstop near restaurant La Sagretia an brings you through the gardens of Villa Borghese to Spanish Steps, Via Veneto etc. At the end of our 4-daytrip, we took a taxi from the hotel, (not the white-ones at the rightside of Pantheon, but a Mercedes E-class) Leonardo the portier made the reservation and we were in 40 minutes time at the airport (costs 55,- euro). One thing more. I wanna go back to Rome!!!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: Adrian B
Reviews.Content: Fantastic location, right on the piazza de rotunda only yards away from the Pantheon, is hotel was great value The rooms were surprisingly large as Rome hotels are notorious for their small rooms, we took an internal room (202) to avoid the noise from the late nights in the piazza, and it was perfectly quite. The breakfast was pretty good if uninspiring, but would highly recommend the hotel and it's friendly staff.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Rome Hotel, Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: KimVelazquez
Reviews.Content: We had two rooms in the hotel for 5 nights in July 2011. It is an outstanding location, you can walk to almost anything you would want to see in Rome. It is fun to sit in the square and people watch at night with a bottle of wine. The breakfast at the hotel is excellent. Each of the rooms had a unique character, no two are the same. We will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Richard K
Reviews.Content: Stayed in this hotel for six nights in February and had a really good experience. It is a 20 minutes walk from the Colosseum in one direction and the Vatican the other. Everything is very close by, it is located at Campo Di Fiori square which is great for food and a market. In terms of the hotel itself the rooms are big, comfortable and the staff are lovely. Only problem I had was on our first night it was very cold due to the snow and poor European weather but extra blankets were given and from that point on the heating wasn't turned off in the hotel. Great price too but be warned, Rome has a €2 per person/per night City Tax that nobody told me about so be prepared to pay that when you're checking out. I would highly recommend this hotel though.

Reviews.Title: “Small hotel, great location, helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: strato57
Reviews.Content: I was able to make a last minute reservation at Albergo del Sole Al Pantheon via Expedia,,, at a great price.... January is off season in Rome, a bit chilly but none of the usual crowds. Hotel is located in one of the great locations in Rome,, i.e steps from the Pantheon and within walking distance of all the main attractions.... Staff was helpful,,, an excellent breakfast ( included) each morning and a full , in room Jacuzzi bath with multiple shower heads was just what the doctor ordered to sooth tired feet after long days of walking around Rome. There was an internet connection in room,, "free until Jan 31st" , operating through the Flat Screen TV,,, however this service did not work... Wireless was available in the Lobby for 5.00 E per hour... Not sure why hotels cannot provide wireless service, at least in the lobby for free.... it is a given in most hotels these days... The hotel is advertised as " the first and oldest hotel in Rome"... Some of the decor including tiles in the Breakfast room are said to be original from early times. Wonderful place to stay

Reviews.Title: “Centrally located antique hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Wont2Travel
Reviews.Content: Thanks to a TA user's tip, we booked this hotel for our 'Roman Holiday' ! And what a gem it is !! Location, location, location !! Centrally located - on the Pantheon square !! Great staff - friendly check-in lady, bellhop, concierge, breakfast-room staff........ The buffet breakfast was sumptuous and had quite a variety of breads, fruits, juices, etc. Both check-in and check-out was handled pretty professionally and post check-out our ample luggage was stored securely (we had a late night flight)

Reviews.Title: “5* Location and Service 2* Accommodation”
Reviews.Author: HollinBank
Reviews.Content: We booked a junior suite for 3 people and pulling in the taxi the location certainly has the "Wow"" factor being based right in Pantheon Square - there is probably no better location in Rome. The public areas of the hotel have been renovated to a high standard, in keeping with its statement as being the oldest hotel in Rome, however I am not able to comment on the rooms as, on arrival, we were re-located to one of several apartments the hotel owns a few minutes away just off the piazza. The apartment we stayed in was located on the 5th floor and actually getting into it was our first challenge as the keys to the entrance grille and main door seemed happy to spin around for 5 minutes without opening the door; whilst at the same time the lights kept going off leaving us waving franticly to switch them back on. The apartment itself was large by city standards. The living room, with sofa bed, acted as the second bedroom for our son during our stay. Off this was a dressing/closet area which led to the main bedroom and en-suite bathroom (which are the only facilities in the room and can only be accessed by walking through the bedroom). The apartment was very dark and very dated - in terms of facilities offered there were two flat screen TVs in the bedroom and living room, a coffee machine, room safe (with the same challenging key arrangements as the main doors) and a radio. There was no wi-fi (which is becoming increasingly expected) and whilst there was a tired jacuzzi bath the only shower arrangements were via a hand held attachment to the taps. We did have problems during our stay with the bathroom - no hot water one evening (but which was remedied straight away when we pointed it out) but there was an unpleasent smell for the duration of our stay and we needed to keep the window open and door closed. We found our bed to be very comfortable, mattress a little hard but we prefer it that way. Based on other places we have stayed the apartment cannot be rated any higher than a 2* and was a real disappointment. The one plus point, and for us it is a big one, is the view. Off the living room accessed through another grille and window/door is a very small balcony (three people standing front to back) however if faces straight out over the Piazza della Rotonda and the Pantheon itself. We were able to spend evenings people watching as the square is filled with activity and entertainment - just need to move the ariel mast as it prevents that perfect picture! Breakfast is taken in the main hotel and consists of a cold buffett of meats, cheeses, breads/pastries and fruit juice/coffee. Whilst not extensive it is just right and sets you up for the day. The hotel itself has no restaurant facilties however you are never short of places to eat in Rome though you certainly have to pay a premium if you choose to eat in one of the main Piazzas. Service from the staff was excellent at all times. In summary, as the review title suggests, a 5* location but only 2* accommodation. We would stay here again but only if travelling as a couple and able to stay in the hotel itself.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Location”
Reviews.Author: ColchesterJohn
Reviews.Content: Wonderful location in the corner of the Pantheon Square. Step outside and have a beer in the early evening and you would think that you have died and gone to heaven. Room typical of a city centre hotel built in the 15th century as it was a bit on the small side. I had to get the hotel to quieten the A/C and tidy up the grouting around the bath – which they did the next day. Croissants were always a bit hard but perhaps that is the way the Italians have them. Staff were all excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible expensive inner junior suite room, hard mattress, no window and dark”
Reviews.Author: Susi C
Reviews.Content: We booked a junior suite for 3 people (Mum, Dad and teenage Son) with a view of the pantheon, we were given an inner room immediately opening onto the breakfast room so the curtain or window could never be opened without someone looking straight inside from a few feet away. I think this was room 104. The bed was completely ROCK hard we folded our blankets and slept on top of them. I have never written a review before and I have never complained before but we would not recommend this hotel to anyone. For the cost we paid for a junior suite for 4 nights the room was appalling, they are purely charging for the room based on the location, our advice is to avoid the hotel and your holiday disappointment at all costs. When we left the hotel and mentioned we were returning soon the man at the check out said 'next time we will see if we can get you a better room'. We had not complained to them or tried to change the room as we were mostly out of the hotel all the time, but that really says it all!! If you suffer from a bad back then don't even consider sleeping in their beds. We are experienced travellers both for pleasure and business but this hotel was too expensive and uncomfortable considering we booked one of their best rooms which turned out to be very disappointing.

Reviews.Title: “Dirty and Expensive but Great location”
Reviews.Author: Firstman
Reviews.Content: If you want to be in a great location near the Pantheon and be very central to everything in Rome, this is your place. If you want the place to be clean and worth the money, this isn't it. First, it's pretty hard to find, especially if you haven't been to the area before. Since it's a pedestrian area, your taxi cannot pull up directly in front, so you'll have to make your way through the hordes of tourists and find the address. Once you do find it, the staff is very friendly. Now, it's time for the room. We booked a Jr Suite for €409 and was pretty shocked to see a €200 room inside. The bathroom had dirty moldings and bathtub caulking, and the room was very dated. For this price, it should have been much nicer. The room had virtually no view from the window and was dark inside. Our group booked two rooms, and we were pretty shocked at what we got. Staff was friendly though and tried to be accommodating, but in peak season, there aren't extra rooms to have the option to move to. Wireless internet was extra on an already high priced night at a mediocre hotel. Try and find a place near the Pantheon, but be weary of this one.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Hotel & Location in Roma @ the Pantheon”
Reviews.Author: Chrstine L
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel on 4 different occasions and this time they really impressed. I returned home on 9/15/11 from a several day stay, and I received an email that I had left a very expensive necklace in the safe. I was so thankful that they contacted me and I immediately gave my credit card so it could be Fed Ex'd home. My necklace arrived in a few days and the hotel picked up the Fed Ex. I did not expect them to do, but I really appreciated. The staff at this hotel is outstanding. Their personnel has changed over the years, but they are always consistently professional and helpful in any way they can accommodate. I will always stay here when in Roma!!! Mila Grazie!

Reviews.Title: “Best view in the world”
Reviews.Author: sxctyguy
Reviews.Content: Its pricey, we paid nearly $400 US dollars per night for the "apartment" which is steps away from the actual hotel. It had 2 windows which faced directly to the Pantheon, and overlooked the plaza. The view is breathtaking! The apartment is not so fabulous, although very large by European hotel standards. Nice sized bathroom (the shower leaks across the marble floor, watch your step) a seperate living room, and private bedroom. The bed is hard as a rock. The TV required 2 remotes, was very confusing. The key ring weighed about a pound, had a heavy brass medalion and 4 keys, one to the entry door at the street, another to two gates in the hallway, and finally a 4th to the hotel room. The room is above a restaurant kitchen, no smell in the room but the hallway and stairs smelled like old grease. The computer can only be accessed from the hotel lobby. I'm glad we stayed there for the 3 days for the experience and the view, but we'll never stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Location! Open the shutters in the morning and view the Pantheon! What could be more magical?”
Reviews.Author: 5starwanderer
Reviews.Content: My favorite location for really enjoying Rome! Pricey, but it's worth the extra to be in the heart of things, and within a short stroll of literally everything Rome has to offer. Staff was excellent; room was small but elegant and clean; breakfast was a feast. But most of all it's a 1400's building and your stay is deep into history from this lovely vantage point.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: CP21
Reviews.Content: Location was excellent, able to walk everywhere. Felt safe walking around in the evenings, plenty of restaurants to choose from. Would pay the extra next time to overlook the Pantheon as the atmosphere in the Piazza della Rotunda was amazing. Staff in the hotel are very helpful. Had a room next to the lift which was really noisy (room 204) so avoid this one if possible. Would go back to this hotel again. Plenty to choose from at breakfast, staff very accomodating and cheerful.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant location, but many problems with the accommodation”
Reviews.Author: JEM189400
Reviews.Content: As I realised from the other reviews on this site, the location of this hotel simply cannot be bettered. You are right opposite the Pantheon - absolutely stunning! HOWEVER - and this is a big however, we are sorry to report many unacceptable aspects. 1. We booked the Ariosto suite several weeks in advance, plus a double room for the children. In addition, I telephoned the hotel to double check the booking (I'd seen a couple of comments on Trip Advisor from guests who had not been given the suite they'd reserved). It was important that we had this suite, as my husband needed the space and comfort to work, while the rest of the family went out doing the sights. However, on arriving, we were told that the Ariosto was 'not available'. We were given another dark, interior suite for the first night, and told that we could have the 'luxury' suite in the annexe the following night. But it turned out that this second, luxury suite did not have internet access, so in the end, the children took this suite, and we took the double room no 108 from the second day of our stay. 2. The airconditioning in 108 did not work. Temperatures were about 35 degrees, and my husband needed to stay in the room to work during the day. We were assured that it was being/would be fixed. Throughout the remaining 3 days of our stay it was never fixed. 3. The bathrooms in the main building were extremely small, and in bad condition. There was mould around several fittings, toilet seats were broken, shower curtains were highly suspect. Overall, our impression was that the volume of guest traffic experienced by this hotel allows the management and staff to provide a service that is significantly below average.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, arrogant "service" from male desk staff, good breakfast”
Reviews.Author: KAcook
Reviews.Content: IMHO when In Rome you can't beat staying near the Pantheon. Yes, crowded, touristy and not cheap - but easy access to everywhere, never more than a few minutes to find a cab and never a lack of people-watching or a place to eat or drink. With that in mind the Sole Al Pantheon seemed to meet our needs. Strike one, however, not made clear on its website, is that there is no direct auto access - taxis can get within about 100 yds, and then you need to walk across the crowded cobbled square with your suitcases. A minor challenge for the young and hale, a tad unpleasant if raining - but could be a real obstacle for anyone at all infirm. You might be able to pay your cabby to linger while you dash to the hotel and hope a bellman is available to come and fetch your luggafe. Anyway, that is a caveat of which to be aware. Second, the male desk staff seems to resent being disturbed by guests. Arrogant deliberate attitude is their forte. "Yes yes yes" said dismissively does not mean the request made will be looked after. I was lied to blatantly about the fan I had requested having been put "by accident" in my cousin's room (who was asleep). In fact no fan had been put in hers or mine. The website advertises a/c but it is not turned on until summer - meanwhile my small (though comfortable) single turned quite hot - and my anger at coming in after dinner to find no fan was not alleviated when the better-mannered but not terrifically savvy (female) desk clerk took me on a late night walk to their "annexe" to see if I found the one vacant room any cooler (it wasn't). She claimed there was only one fan in the entire hotel. To her credit, an hour later she had borrowed one (which worked briefly) from another hotel - so she said. Anyway the whole episode was absurd for a supposedly 4 star hotel and left a bad taste in my mouth. I noticed the rude young man (about whom I spoke to the male manager who seemed to care less) could not meet my eyes when we checked out the third morning. Against that, the rooms are clean, the bathrooms spacious and everything works though it takes a while to rustle up the hot water (again, management purports to be amazed at the problem but others have reported it too on this and other sites); the buffet breakfast was tasty with lots of choice and pleasant service if you wanted eggs or tea, etc ; the bellboys extremely nice and willing. There is a large sized lounge for guests to use. And there is an archaic - but FREE - internet access via your TV which will drive any N American mad until you figure its quirks. It is useless for anything much more than checking emails - but if that saves you lugging around a laptop (it did me) then it is a plus. Overall, we thought the hotel was wonderfully situated and pleasantly furbished - but the price vs the arrogant staff members would make it a no go another time in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location but otherwise a fairly average hotel”
Reviews.Author: Jodie_FM
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for a few nights on our honeymoon, using it as our stopover in Rome en route from Venice to Sicily. Having read mixed reviews on Trip Advisor we were not sure what to expect. The reality is that most of the reviews are correct - we had a lovely stay but there are some quirks that you would not expect in a hotel of this price range. The obvious plus is the location - an easy walk to all the main tourist attractions in Rome, a feeling of being right in the heart of one of the most amazing cities in the world, and of course the wonderful view of the Pantheon (we paid a little extra for a standard room with a view) plus the people watching in the piazza below. The hotel claims to be the oldest in Rome and does have some character, but is perhaps not as charming as you might expect. Although attractively decorated, there are no obvious signs of historical significance, and our room was fairly typical of many hotel rooms in European cities - small but comfortable. We found the staff generally to be friendly and helpful, but the hotel does have a few niggles. For example, the air con mysteriously didn't operate in our room one night, the toilet flush was a bit unreliable, the jacuzzi function in the bathtub didn't work and they charge extra for WiFi which is only available downstairs. Given that we were on a relaxing holiday these things didn't bother us too much but I can see that many people would find them annoying. In summary, if you're on a romantic or family break, want something a bit special and are prepared to overlook a few foibles, this is your place. If you are expecting business class facilities (which you could reasonably expect for the price) probably best to look elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: mudfoot
Reviews.Content: Some staff very helpful, others not so much. We had a great view of the Parthenon. There was a booger on the wall of my room that creeped me out and made it impossible to sleep until I dislodged it myself.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and an amazing view!”
Reviews.Author: traveller6719
Reviews.Content: We stayed four nights in a suite and it was great. From our room you could see the Pantheon and the piazza below. Never needed to take a taxi anywhere since you can walk every where. The hotel was very clean and quite nicely decorated inside. The staff were friendly enough and always willing to help out if you needed it. I'd stay here again no problem. Free wi-fi would have been nice. Who doesn't have a smart phone these days? If you're complaining about the TV you should have stayed at home. It wasn't what I would call cheap but it was inline with other places that I checked out. We had a suite and it wasn't much more than most rooms. This is Rome and cheap isn't a word they used that I'm aware of. When you walk straight out of the hotel you are in the middle of all the action. The trevi fountain is a ten minute walk and so is piazza navarone. The cafe straight thru the front door had the best tasting cappuccino of any of the places i tried.

Reviews.Title: “Location is the ONLY thing good about this hotel.”
Reviews.Author: MonBon7
Reviews.Content: Although this hotel is centrally located, you'll pay a HIGH price for an uncaring staff (other than the very nice young bell hop named Anthony), less than mediocre a/c, tiny room, etc. The internet is free on the TV, however the navigation is soley with the TV remote and takes painstakingly long. We finally opted to pay the $15.00 fee for the WiFi on our laptop. There is no bar, nor is there a restaurant. They have a nice breakfast, but DO NOT show up before the 7:00 AM posted time or you'll receive a less than courteous welcome. Beware of the 12,00 Euro city tax you have to pay in cash. This hotel will also offer you a pick up service at the airport. Our flight was delayed due to weather and we kept in close contact with them, letting them know we would be late. We did indeed get picked up by their offered driver but at check out time, they tried to double charge us, as they said the driver had to go to the airport twice. Seriously? I would never recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Quirky hotel in perfect location”
Reviews.Author: UKYork
Reviews.Content: It's all about location with this hotel which is ideal for walking to all major sites - never had to use taxis or public transport. Our Superior room was at the front overlooking the piazza and we were able to see part of the Pantheon. The decor is quirky and the room adequate size and we loved the sounds of Rome from the piazza - didn't disturb us at all. Staff were all helpful and we really enjoyed the breakfasts which comprised a large selection of fresh continental style items. Another plus point is that the other guests were from a range of different nationalities so not a typical 'Brits abroad' hotel. We would return again but probably only in low season again to take advantage of reasonable rates.

Reviews.Title: “This Hotel let us down and completely ruined our 40th Wedding Anniversary”
Reviews.Author: maureenfrances
Reviews.Content: We booked six weeks before for our 40th Wedding anniversary and had the booking confirmed the week before we travelled. We asked for a view flowers and the car to pick us up from the airport. As we entered Rome we had a phone call to say no room was available. They booked us into an unsuitable hotel with a demonstration going on outside , shouting, noise police etc. It turned into a nightmare. So beware.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel was lovely, clean and centrally located.”
Reviews.Author: sulligeo
Reviews.Content: The room was charming (with an amazing view of the Pantheon) and clean. Most of the staff was pleasant and went out of their way to help with questions (how do I operate the cell phone here?), recommendations and anything else we needed. The breakfast buffet was delicious and plentiful and it was served efficiently and pleasantly. I would highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “WATCH OUT!!! YOUR BOOKING IS NOT VALID”
Reviews.Author: HELLINIDA
Reviews.Content: I was in Rome this Weekend with my parents and my brother. I had booked through an agency one superior room and one Junior Suite in this hotel.Few days before our arrival we had reconfirmed our bookings. When we arrived they told us that it has been a mistake and they had not for the first night the Junior Suite that we had booked and we had paid. Instead of this they offer us a classic room, which was awful and had 100% humidity!!! I asked the hotel manager. They told me that he was not in the hotel and we called him from the reception desk. He was not flexible and very polite. Finally they provide us a room to a nearby hotel but not a Junior Suite that We had paid for...On Saturday night offered to my parents a champagne of very low quality... Becareful next day in front of my eyes the same thing done with another couple.....On the other hand, the rest personnel was extremely helpful and polite!! And the breakfast had very good quality..!

Reviews.Title: “Great choice for tourists - great location.”
Reviews.Author: TravelinDantheMan
Reviews.Content: This is a great place to stay in the heart of Rome. You can walk to the Vatican and the the Colosseum - in fact, you can walk to most of the major sights in Rome. It was a great place to use as a base. The hotel is nicely refurbished and comfortable. Lots of stairs! Each room is different, some big and beautiful with views of the Pantheon, some (like mine - room 318) was tiny with a single bed and no view. Nonetheless, this is a touristy area and I loved it. The breakfast was excellent - nice variety. I would surely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Beware this hotel”
Reviews.Author: philomenafog
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel through a website with confirmation and arrived to find "Oh Dear" they had booked us in for the following month. Had to spend one night in the "Sister " hotel around the corner in a suite with only a skylight and a view if you were a giraffe and the next night in the hotel annexe which was disgusting and not what we had booked or paid for. When I tried to complain was met with blank stares though on arrival we were "treated" to a drinks with compliments- they obviously knew what was coming. We mistook duplicity for charm. Had to spend part of our break packing and moving luggage. Location fantastic but check before you go if you must stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Location”
Reviews.Author: MsLondon2
Reviews.Content: My husband and a dear friend of ours stayed at this Hotel with views of the Pantheon. The breakfast was okay great espresso! The Hotel's location was a great location convenient to restaurants and major streets and attractions. We would definelty stay here again. The rooms were clean and good views. The rooms were overlooking the Pantheon and I loved falling alseep to the clatter of people milling about and restaurants closing.The staf were from friendly to not so depending on the staff member.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Location in Rome”
Reviews.Author: Bree22
Reviews.Content: We spent two nights at the Albergo del Sole Al Pantheon in early September. Location, location, location! Besides the view of the Pantheon, which was amazing, it is in the center of the historic area of Rome. Easy walk to Trevi Fountain, Piazza Navona, Castel Sant’ Angelo, etc. We stayed in the hotel’s annex which directly faced the Pantheon. It was a lovely two-story family suite on the top floor (Room 501). The room had gorgeous woodwork throughout the suite and was appointed with everything you would need for a comfortable stay. It also had a Juliette style balcony overlooking the Pantheon and a much larger balcony off the upstairs bedroom which had seating for 4. Staff was very pleasant and helpful. Breakfast was included in the rate and was served in the main hotel building in a nice garden area. Nice assortment of meats, cheeses, pastries, etc. and fresh made cappuccino. I must add that if your hotel preference is modern, then you most likely would not care for this hotel. If you appreciate old, ornate and charming, you'll love this hotel. Our last time in Rome, while wandering through the city, I was always curious what lay behind some of the ornate residential doors, so…..one of the fun aspects of staying in the hotel annex was the giant set of room keys (skeleton) you are given (see picture). The entrance doors are very large wooden doors and it made us feel like real Rome residents for a few days.

Reviews.Title: “Right in the middle of everything”
Reviews.Author: Brandon63
Reviews.Content: Charming little hotel in the heart of Rome, adjacant to The Pantheon. Everything is pocket-sized in this perfectly comfortable romantic little hotel with a family atmosphere. Rooms are nice, beautiful and very comfortable, the staff is both helpful and competent, and the breakfast was just perfect. Great location too.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed return, not a great stay”
Reviews.Author: itlay2
Reviews.Content: We had stayed 13 years ago and came back to enjoy again. However, it was disappointing. The room had black mold all over the ceiling of the bathroom! Very unappealling and a health concern. In addition, we had the room right next to the breakfast room and at @6:30 every morning were awaken by the clanging of dishes being set up for breakfast. The room was loud and moldy. I have contacted the hotel about both situations to no avail. For a four star hotel, it lacks. We will not return.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, fantasic view!!!”
Reviews.Author: MattCarib
Reviews.Content: Loved my stay at the Sole Al Pantheon. The location is perfect for a stay in Rome. The beauty of Rome is all of the life in the Piazza's. That is the real heart of Rome ; the Collesuem and the Vatican are must see attractions but they are just that tourist attractions. The central Rome piazzas are where the real action is at and it makes Rome unlike any city I have ever visited. This hotel is right in the heart of the Pantheon piazza and our room overlooked the piazza below as well as the a great view (a little to the left out the window) of the Pantheon front facade. The location is perfect for a stroll to Piazza Navona - great food and very lively huge piazza. This area of central Rome is very safe at night and unlike other areas free from the sometimes overly pushy street vendors at he Trevi Fountain and Spanish Steps. We walked all around at midnight or slightly later and never once felt uncomfortable. The best part of this hotel though, is the ability to open the Huge windows and hear the action on the Piazza below ; went to sleep to the sound of wine glasses clinging and restaurants closing down and woke up to the street cleaners and garbage trucks. Loved it felt like part of the city. if you want complete peace and quiet thy have rooms facing the garden backside which are ver silent but we wanted the views and the sites and sounds of the piazza and it was more than we could ask for, The room was very large and had a great bathroom and all of the amenitys we wanted. Breakfast was excellent and in a very pretty room. Despite not being a "hot" breakfast I enjoyed breakfast here better than the other 2 hotels we stayed at in Italy and thought there Cappucino was the best of the 3 as well. The hotel had a very boutique feel, I felt the service and staff were very friendly and always available if you needed them. There is no restaurant and this is a small hotel, maybe 20 rooms maybe less, not really certain. The front is very charming and easy to miss. Everything is very classy. Small hotel so don't expect a spa, pool, etc... that 5 star travelers may be accustomed to but for different reasons this is definitely a 5 star hotel. In Italy can't be 5 star without a restaurant so consider this the best possible 4 star option around. Easily walking distance to Trevi Fountain, all of the Piazza's, Spanish Steps not too far nor is the Collesuem. Though we took a taxi to the Vatican. Pantheon is as close as it looks and has free admission. Near to the hotel are some of the most famous places for Gelato, Cappucino and Pizza all within a very short stroll. I am writing this review after a 20 hour trip home and am tired and without a list so names may not be 100% accurate but our close: Gelato: gellateria (only steps a way, the best and also very cheap - all of the locals go here) Cappucino: Sant Euchstachio (only steps away, same thing the best and very cheap, also many locals) Pizza: Pizza Baffetto - 5 or so minute walk, a little past Piazza Navona. Cheap and the best. - also many locals My only small negatives were the wifi (hotel was free internet in the rooms but it is a very slow usable TV computer with wireless keyboard that was more aggreviating than helpful and I couldn't get th hotel wifi to function on my Iphone. There is also a desktop computer in the lobby was I used for a brief time for a very small fee which worked but also was very slow for Internet use. This one negative is definitely not enough for me not to give a 5 star rating considering service, location and view more important than Internet! Overall the hotel cost is higher than I would normaly spend for a room on a nightly basis but location is very important in Rome especially if on a short stay like we were and I believe paying a premium to be right in the heart of Central Rome was well worth it and would highly recommend the Sole Al Pantheon.

Reviews.Title: “Great location near all major attractions”
Reviews.Author: Wasif77
Reviews.Content: We stayed 4 nights at this hotel. The location is awesome as it right next to the Pantheon and near to the major tourist attractions. The staff were friendly. The only downside is that given the location it can get quite noisy till late in the night. They also do not provide extra cots / beds for children as there is not enough space in the rooms. Overall had a great time.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel and location”
Reviews.Author: jonv07
Reviews.Content: four star hotel that feels like a five star hotel in it's location, first and last impressions. Friendly staff and deluxe rooms.

Reviews.Title: “The best location, very friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: jodie_c79
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Junior suite which was 2 levels, it was fantastic with a child. The room was huge for Rome standards. As everything in room, the room was old, a little mould in the bathroom however it was clean. The size of the room was everything and considering its size we thought it was good value. The staff were fantastic and very friendly. The cot was there in the room on arrival and they booked airport transfers and made sure there was a baby seat. A very good experience.

Reviews.Title: “Honeymoon heaven - we loved evey minute & did not want to leave”
Reviews.Author: Marcus013
Reviews.Content: Location , location ,location . This hotel is exceptionally placed in the heart of Rome . We had a room looking onto the piazza , with the Pantheon only metres away . We found the staff friendly & helpful , a special thanks to Leonardo who took our booking over the phone only a day before we arrived having been let down by another hotel in Rome & one from one of the usual booking rooms sites !!!!! Breakfast was lovely served on the terrace with the staff really friendly . Our room was clean and spacious with a high beamed ceiling adding to our romance. The only down side was there were no coffee/ tea maing facilities in the room ... but this is only a trifle quibble , our first time in Rome & definitely not our last & we will return to the Albergo del Sole again ... fantastic , fantastic , fantastic ..... enjoy you will

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Location - Not Perfect”
Reviews.Author: tjl153
Reviews.Content: I spent a weekend in Rome and stayed at this hotel. The location can't be beat. They have rooms overlooking the Pantheon which is awesome and central to Rome's attractions. I walked everywhere from there. There are also a lot of good restaurant's and cafes in the area. When I arrived they told me my room had been upgraded and took me across the piazza to an enormous room overlooking the Pantheon. The bathroom in this room was the smallest bathroom I've ever seen in my life...but I'll chalk that up to the building being hundreds of years old. The room had a huge bedroom and a sitting room. The view was AMAZING. I noticed the room was extremely hot. I couldn't get the AC to turn on and one of the units was dripping water onto the floor. The desk clerk came to the room and also could not get the AC to function. He told me that since it was late on Friday night it could not be fixed till the next morning and that I could stay or move my room if I wanted. I moved because there was no way I could sleep in a room that was that hot. They gave me a smaller room (which had a much larger, better bathroom) in the main building overlooking their courtyard. The AC was functioning fine and I got a good night's sleep. I packed all my things in the morning so I could move back to the room with the nice view on Saturday night. After coming back from sightseeing I was told that they couldn't fix the AC in the other room until Monday so I'd have to stay in the smaller room. That bummed me out. The wireless internet was also not working during part of my stay and it was annoying that the only place it was available was in the lobby. Other than the room problem the hotel was clean and the staff was friendly. The little buffet breakfast was sufficient as well. Overall an excellent location, but not sure it was worth the price.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect hotel, perfect location!”
Reviews.Author: FamilyoffourPA
Reviews.Content: Just traveled to Italy for the first time with our two children. I searched for hours on tripadvisor.com looking for the right hotel. We definitely got it right. First, the location of this hotel is perfect. We walked everywhere. Nothing took more than 20-25 minutes to walk, Vatican, Coliseum, Spanish steps, etc. At no time did we not feel safe walking anywhere. The area around the hotel is busy all day and night so you can always find a place to get a drink or something to eat. We stayed at the apartment across the street from the hotel in Apt. 5. The room was nice, the bed was less than ideal, but it was a king size bed. Our daughters had their own room and shared a pull out sofa. The apartment was definitely large enough. We were very nervous about ending up in a small room, but it wasn't the case. Downside was no iron in the room and the hotel charged about $6 euros for each item to iron. Pack a travel iron. The hotel staff was very helpful and friendly. Our personal favorite was Dante. He was beyond helpful. We asked him for help in finding a nice restaurant one night and he walked us about 5-10 minutes from the hotel and personally talked the host and got a great table outside. I read mixed reviews about this hotel before going, but very honestly, our experience was completely positive. I am sure there are hotels just as nice or nicer, but this was perfect for a family of four.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, but that's all.”
Reviews.Author: cid12
Reviews.Content: This seems like a 2 star hotel with 5 star prices and attitude. They did show us many rooms before we could find one that we felt somewhat comfortable in. We were pre paid, or we would have left immediately. The upholstered head board had hair/oil stains (we asked for an additional sheet to cover it); the blanket from the closet was dirty; the bedspread was dirty; there was mold in the shower. I was happy they gave us slippers because I was uncomfortable walking on the carpet in bare feet. On a good note, the location is terrific, breakfast is good and the porter was very helpful and nice.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location for a Roman Holiday”
Reviews.Author: jadaw2000
Reviews.Content: From the outset, we had nothing but good service from the Albergo del Sole al Pantheon. We booked directly with the hotel using their website. All enquires made via email (in English) were promptly and courteously responded to, including arranging a car to collect us from the airport. This was our first trip to Rome and found it to be a perfect location for sightseeing as we could walk to every location that we wanted to see. We booked a 'Superior Pantheon view' room which did not have a direct view of the Pantheon (as it is a little to one side of the Pantheon) however it had a wonderful view of the Piazza della Rotunda. Some reviews had talked about the noise from the Piazza at night being a problem, however we actually found that this added to the 'atmosphere' of the location and chose to sleep with the window open at night. The sounds of the music in the piazza, the people coming and going, the clink of china & wine glasses and the sound of horses hooves on the cobble stones as they pulled the carriages we found to be charming. Our room was impeccably clean and comfortable (if not overly large, but this is Europe after all) and the bathroom more than adequate. The hotel staff were always courteous & helpful and the included breakfast was a wonderful start to any day of sightseeing. We would highly recommend this hotel to anyone visiting Rome who does not need the 'whistles and bells' of a five star hotel. We would definitefly stay here again when we return to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “LOVELY OLD HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: 051610a
Reviews.Content: Very spacious room, large bathroom with best shower ever!! We stayed here a week & were quite comfortable, however, had trouble sleeping, noise from nearby bars & cafes kept me awake each night, hotel is lovely & old, great little cafe right next door.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, lots of Character... a bit old but charming”
Reviews.Author: A3Queen
Reviews.Content: we loved the location. we booked the family suite.. first night we were in room 111.. and had a horrible night sleep as it was sooo loud! thankfully the front desk was GREAT and moved us the next night to the top floor suite 501. It had 2 terraces and we slept great. Tv changels were great... flat screen tvs.. for night. could sleep 4 easily. Amazing location and beautiful breakfasts.. it was definitely old and funky, but cool and worth it. We would stay again. It felt much more like Rome than staying in some chic expensive place like we've done before. we could walk to piazza navona, trevi fountain, and all of ancient rome pretty easily. good find. thanks trip advisor!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location...but bring your ear plugs”
Reviews.Author: CTProfessional
Reviews.Content: This hotel is clean, has a great breakfast and is well located (assuming you don't mind being in the middle of a busy square/tourist attraction)...you can walk everywhere, including the Vatican and Colosseum and it's perfectly fine for a quick stay in Rome. It's nice stepping out at night to enjoy the view of the Pantheon without all of the tourists you'll find during the day. We were there for 2 and 1/2 days and had an internal room. You should BELIEVE the reviews about the noise, particularly if you're jet-lagged and wish to nap at all during the day or early evening. Perhaps it's the age of the hotel but you can hear EVERYTHING...everyone walking in the hall, everyone getting in and out of the elevator, even people flushing their toilets in the rooms next door. For that reason alone I would not stay there again or recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Higly noisy”
Reviews.Author: Morigi
Reviews.Content: We booked the family suite number 107. Fantastic view of the Pantheon and La rotonda square but..... seems like to be on the road! Very noisy till 1 A.M.... Also, the sofabed needs to be changed....

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel, excellent location”
Reviews.Author: richieccc
Reviews.Content: It's a place to sleep, nothing more, but nice enough. Very old, but the room was modern. Not plush, but comfortable. Small room. No coffee in room (or in hotel, for that matter). Great location, we could easily walk to many sights. No problem staying busy for a week. Nearby restaurants are pricey, but very nice. Staff was helpful and friendly. They booked a tour for us, made wakeup calls, got us a cab to the airport, etc. It ain't the Hilton Beverly Hills, but for a quaint hotel smack dab in the center of Rome, it was fine.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location and Great Atmosphere”
Reviews.Author: bcm05c
Reviews.Content: My wife and I came to Rome for 7 days for a "Babymoon" in March of 2010. We stayed for 7 days at this hotel and by far this was the nicest experience we have ever had in Europe. Our room was in their annex that overlooked the Pantheon unlike the side view from the actual hotel. Our room was on the top floor of the annex in which it included a separate living room with sleeper sofa, LCD t.v, cappuccino machine and mini fridge. In that same room we had a balcony that contained a view to die for as we could throw a tennis ball to the steps of the Pantheon. One word, AMAZING. The bedroom was quaint as this is one of the oldest hotels in Rome but really charming and clean still. We had a separate LCD t.v in the bedroom and then a bathroom fit for a king with whirlpool tub. Noise was not an issue as some reviewers had mentioned, but the birds are ridiculous, they sound like a woman screaming. Our room was cleaned and prepped every morning as well as everything restocked. As for the hotel itself, the continental breakfast was just plain Awesome with pastries and breads as well as Prosciutto and mozzarella cheese to name a few. The breakfast truly saved us as Rome is not that cheap and a good FREE meal makes the day even better. The hotel it just picture perfect in every way. The staff are extremely helpful and courteous even with ignorant American travelers as myself. The location honestly is what makes this hotel stand out above the rest. My wife was 26 weeks pregnant and we were able to walk to almost every location because of the central location of the hotel. When places were too far it is nice to have a taxi stand right outside our door. There is also the best Gellato place in all of Rome right underneath our hotel and a McDonald's for those a bit timid on European Cuisine (If that floats your Boat). When we go back to Rome we will stay here again no doubt. Cons: Our bed was kind of hard but truly None: I have recommended this hotel 20 times in the two days we have been back.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, but noisy....”
Reviews.Author: sydneyseasons
Reviews.Content: Great location in close walking distance to key attractions and areas in room. However, the noise is a concern. Thin walls and housekeeping that begins at 7:00 in the morning. If you want to get up early than this is the perfect choice.

Reviews.Title: “delightful”
Reviews.Author: cheekyrn1
Reviews.Content: stayed here for 2 evenings had a suite in the annex our view was directly in front of the pantheon which was amazing!!! hotel staff was very nice room was clean great bathroom the piazza was very noisy but did not keep us awake at night perfect location for sightseeing buffet breakfast adequate numerous nearby restaurants to choose from

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location in Rome”
Reviews.Author: Bobbi48128
Reviews.Content: My mother and I stayed at this hotel for 2 nights in October. It was absolutely wonderful. We had a view of the square below us, and if we turned our heads, we had the most wonderful view of the Pantheon. Thought the square is very busy, with the windows closed there was no noise at all. The rooms was decorated nicely, and we had plenty of room in own twin bedded room on the 4th (their 3rd) floor. Also, the staff was extremely friendly and helpful. I highley recommend this hotel for its location, its staff, and the charm.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: skikatieski
Reviews.Content: This hotel worked out great for our family. The location in unbeatable! You literally look at the Pantheon out of your window. We stayed in the annex and it worked out great for our family of 4. The rooms were spotless. Yes, it may seem a little dark, but this hotel is the oldest hotel in Rome! We loved the history that comes along with the hotel. The breakfast was fantastic and the staff was very helpful. I would definitely stay a this hotel again!

Reviews.Title: “The best view during our trip”
Reviews.Author: HollywoodPortland
Reviews.Content: First, I'm not sure if it's this Albergo del Sole that claims to be Rome's oldest hotel or if it's the Albergo Del Sole Al Biscione 76 near the Campo dei Fiori. Anyway, this one is right in the Pantheon plaza. The front desk clerk and bellhop were first rate: among other things, they searched the Internet for 15 minutes for other hotels (as they were booked the next night.) The breakfast was the best of any hotel during our trip; they had this egg on toast concoction that was delicious. Our suite was huge: the downstairs was a big living room with enough room for yoga/exercise. The top main bedroom more than ample, but the bathroom was very small in relation to everything else. The bed was very comfortable. The view…well, please see the photo. We loved this place, it was a major highlight of our trip.

Reviews.Title: “The perfect find-service and locationin one”
Reviews.Author: PICKYTRAVELOR1
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at many of the 5 star hotels in Rome, last one being the Westin Excelsior. This hotel was by far the best we have stayed at for many reasons and I think it is a four star. Prominent Reasons to stay here are: Service and Location. The manager, Maurizio, is kind and gracious and reccomended some great things to do and eat. He is super at making your vacation special. What a nice man and his staff is terrific. One fabulous place he reccomended was Le Volte, which is a cafe around the corner and had a vaulted ceiling believed to be painted by Michangelo. It is family run and a great find. We kept find ourselves ignoring our travel reecomendations and eating there because it was fun and really good food. The hotel is superbly located---We got in a cab once to go the Vatican and that was only because it was early and the furthest. Everywhere else including all the churches in De Vinci Code book were walkable for my teenage son. We LOVED staying here because when you open up the window you know you are in Rome. Our room overlooked the Pantheon. Everywhere else we have stayed was beautiful but we could have been at a four seasons hotel anywhere in the world. This is Rome, it's flavors, its history, and its amusements. The plaza outside the hotel had street violinists and varous acts to entertain the plazza lined cafes and provided my son the chance to people watch from the room. Food was just out side your room so my son could go grab a pizza. The Hotel food was a nice morning spread to carry thru lunch so you can get to sightseeing and not fuss with breakfast. They had enough of everything to not get tired in our 6 day stay. It was beautifully presented. I will never stay anywhere else. Wake up in Rome! This is the life! I live in Santa Barbara California so I must admit I am spoiled and this hotel definately met my expectations!

Reviews.Title: “Within walking distance to everything”
Reviews.Author: Kristin_California
Reviews.Content: When we checked in we found our room stunk like cigarette smoke so we went down to the front desk, apologized for being spoiled American/Californians who are not accustomed to anything but non-smoking, and asked to change rooms. They do not have any non-smoking rooms but were very understanding and said they would do the "sniff" test is some of the other available rooms to see if there was something more suitable. They did find us another room and moved our luggage over which was very kind. The rooms are very small but clean and the bathrooms were very modern. The location is perfect. We walked to all major sites in Rome. A standard continental breakfast with meat & cheese is included. Overall I think this is a good deal for the price (for Rome which is expensive).

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel, in the best location”
Reviews.Author: bloodytourist
Reviews.Content: Me and my girlfriend stayed in this hotel in the beginning of April, and it was a really good experience. The room was excelent, and the service too. Everything that you want on a romantic holiday in Rome!

Reviews.Title: “Got my money's worth”
Reviews.Author: anon73
Reviews.Content: Hard to review this hotel. We have been to Rome several times in the past, so we knew the location very well, and that was the reason we selected this hotel. We stayed in the suite in the annex portion of the hotel, room 311. The location is great, right on Piazza Rotunda, you can easily walk to any attraction in the city. From the hotel, it's about 35 minute walk to the Coliseum or Vatican, and 20 minutes to Piazza di Spagna - 3 locations on completely opposite ends of the historical center. All the other attractions are within this triangle - so you are close to everything. The suite is very large - more than adequate for 2 people, would be fine for 3 (daybed in sitting area). Opens directly onto the plaza, with great great view of the Pantheon. The staff was friendly and accommodating (checked us in before 12 while their policy was 2 pm). These are the best qualities of this hotel. It definitely is not what I would expect a suite in a 4 star hotel to be like. The room, though very spacious, lacked any character, was very sparsely decorated, and had a miniature bathroom (turning around in it one had to be careful not to knock off toiletries). The view was great, but we kept our drapes and shutters closed because it was very noisy. The breakfast was adequate, but not extensive or particularly tasty. The location was very convenient, but there are dozens of other hotels in a 3 block radius. We have stayed in many small hotels around Europe and knew what to expect. A 4 star rating is far too generous. Consider it a small, clean, well-run, centrally located 3 star, and compare it against others in the same category. The hotel needs to either drop a star from its rating to reflect the level of accommodations, or do some serious renovations. That being said, I feed I shouldn't be complaining because at the end of the day, I paid 175 euros/night, inc. breakfast, for a huge suite overlooking the Pantheon. Even though the room and the hotel was not what I would expect from a 4 star, neither was the price. The room was noisy, but you can't have both a quiet stay and a view of the prettiest and busiest square in Rome. I am sure other rooms very quieter. So, even though I have serious reservations about staying in this hotel again, I did get great bang for the buck. Had the hotel been rated a 3 star as it deserves, I think my expectations would have been met. Book it if you get a good deal on it.

Reviews.Title: “Best Location and View”
Reviews.Author: sasquatch989
Reviews.Content: If you want a view of the pantheon, you need to ensure you get a room with a view. It will cost more, tho. Hotel was clean, services friendly, breakfast buffet outstanding; a large variety with some daily changes. Free internet on TV with laptop option. Room was a bit dusty. bathtub meant for baths and not showers as there is no shower curtain. Plus side: Jacuzzi tub. The hotel's mercedes can take you to the airport for 55E flat, which is nice if you have an early flight. The piazza it sits on is bustling day and night so there is always something open for you to eat or drink. The restaurant directly across from the hotel had the best gellato we had the whole trip, esp the dark chocolate gellato. We went during early March, so the tourist season was not yet in full swing. I can imagine things being worse around July.

Reviews.Title: “Beware”
Reviews.Author: odysseus_9
Reviews.Content: We stayed one night in the annex room and were very disappointed. The annex is severly in need of a FULL renovation. Old bed covers , miniscule closet bathroom, musty and dusty. Very noisy, even in early Dec. Bed unconfirtable , hard and sqeeky.The view of the Pantheon was great but coulld not make up for the negatives. The front desk receptionist Luigi was arrogant and unhelpful. The breakfast was adequate and the breakfast lady very nice and sweet.I can not see how this can be a 4 star hotel. I can not recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: jan59Essex
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 nights - we had a good view of the Pantheon if we leaned out of the window, otherwise we looked across the Piazza. The piazza is really buzzing, great in Nov. but would be noisy in the summer if you wanted the windows open. The room was v. pleasant but we found the beds hard & the bathroom small, but the breakfasts were excellent - little bowls of fruit salad, scrambled eggs & pancetta on toast, peaches & fresh yoghurt, baked apples with muesli & cinamon, all served in an open-air courtyard in the middle of the hotel (even in November). because of an awning & patio heaters. Although the location is great, it is quite a way from the nearest metro - not a problem if the weather's good or you like walking. We would stay here again because of the location. We found a great day out of Rome - take the train from termini to Castel Gandolfo, the Pope's summer residence overlooking a huge lake. which is in the crater of a defunct volcano. Next door is a great restaurant, Pagnanelli's, where if you contact them, they will arrange a wine-tasting & give you a tour of the cellars - fantastic.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous location, great hotel”
Reviews.Author: nelly101
Reviews.Content: The hotel overlooks the pantheon - one of the best preserved sites in Rome. Hotel is lovely - good service & nice rooms. Breakfast isn't great but sufficient - cold continental food only. Would definately return.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, overrated.”
Reviews.Author: kimparklee
Reviews.Content: My wife did the tour of Italy on our honeymoon, starting in Venice, going to Florence, then Rome, then Positano. This was the only really disappointing hotel. We stayed just one night. The rooms were dark, musty, and the bathroom smelled mildewy. We asked for a better room, but were told it was the best one. I have to confess that you can see the Pantheon from the window, but that is the only saving grace. It amazes me that this place is featured in so many design hotel books and articles. Needs a serious overhaul.

Reviews.Title: “A Positive Experience”
Reviews.Author: sdimeglio
Reviews.Content: As a result of having misbooked our reservations to begin our stay at the Albergo del Senato, we arrived in Rome with no place to stay on the night of our arrival. The desk concierge at del Senato, Salvatore, quickly arranged accommodations for us at the Albergo del Sole Al Pantheon for the evening for half price!. The large apartment suite was in a separate building from the hotel and directly faced the Pantheon. This was a large suite with a king size bed, a sitting room, a very modern bathroom, a large screen tv over the fireplace and a writing desk. It was nicely furnished overall. We had a key to enter the building as well as our room key. The front desk representative and bellhop were both professional and welcoming. The only issue with our stay was with the air-conditioning which was not working very well at all. It was 90+ degrees during our stay in Rome and the room was very uncomfortable because the AC didn't do the job. The next four nights we stayed at the Senato and the AC cooled the room more effectively. In summary, a positive experience particularly in light of the emergency situation and the discount.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location in the Center of Rome”
Reviews.Author: NcSailor
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 2 nights in Late May 2008. We arrived early and the hotel graciously allowed us to leave our luggage while we went out and explored the city. Our room was a "double room superior" and overlooked the Pantheon Square. The view was tremendous but so was the noise at night (if you left the window open like we did). Being heavy sleepers the noise was not a problem for us, but if you like fresh air and can't deal with the noise a courtyard room might be more appropriate. (Had the A/C worked better I might have closed the window at bedtime). The hotel staff were all super friendly, the breakfast was fantastic, the room clean and comfortable. The location is simply out of this world. It was within walking distance of everywhere that we wanted to go. About 20 min walk to the Vatican was the longest walk. We enjoyed our stay and would suggest it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous: Location, Location, Location”
Reviews.Author: kimv3020
Reviews.Content: My daughter, BFF and her son stayed at the Sole Al Pantheon for 3 nights at the end of June. We had just completed a 12 day cruise and were exhausted but ready to experience Rome. This was my third trip but my friend and her son's first. I selected this hotel based on reviews off of this website and its wonderful LOCATION. It is the best location if you are staying in Rome....close to everything...we walked every where...even to the Vatican and Coloseum. My daughter and I stayed in one of the junior suites that overlooked the square/Pantheon. This was fabulous...and what I would recommend. All staff were wonderful. The breakfast was the best I have ever had in Europe! One of the best things was the honesty of the Staff! Upon arrival home in Houston....I discovered that I had left a very expensive bracelet in the safety deposit box. The manager Maurizio Taliano tracked it down and as we speak...it is being FedEx's to me. This integrity has amazed me. It would have been very easy to say that it was not available, because it was 2 days until I realized that it was missing. My daughter and I are so thankful....I would most certainly recommend and stay at this beautiful hotel in the future.

Reviews.Title: “central location, great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Standbytraveler
Reviews.Content: I found my experience at this hotel delightful, the room was clean, well maintained by Catherine, and ample; clean bathroom and rather large; large screen flat-TV, but wish their mini-bar was empty to use as a refrig. The breakfast was excellent, more than excellent; staff generous with their time and always assisted me when needed. Would not hesitate to stay again, which I do expect. I was a single male traveler. HOWEVER, i would caution all to stay away from a local retail store,acroos the square and to the left of the entrance of the hotel which is directly across from a store named Armando Al Pantheon and Paper Moon; the retail to avoid is a coffee shop and gift shop; the store had an outside sign reading as follows: Regali Di Rienzo(Di Rienzo): They are selling phone cards that DO NOT WORK AND ARE BLOCKED WHEN YOU ATTEMPT TO CALL; and absolutely refuse to take the cards back by simply stating whatever your complaint is "impossible." Be forewarned and avoid this store at all costs. John P. Naples, FL, USA

Reviews.Title: “Hated everything but the location”
Reviews.Author: AmyCS
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for two nights in February, when my boyfriend surprised me with a weekend break. On arrival, the staff were rude and didn't appear to have any time for us. Once we were able to find the room, we found a tiny double room - there was about two foot of clear space either side of the bed, and just enough room to walk past at the bottom. The bathroom was a wet room, with a broken pastic shutter door that didn't close fully. The bathroom was dirty, you could literally run your finger along the tiny white plastic shelves and they would be coated. The furniture in the bedroom was ok though. The neighbourhood is a little loud at night, but as you are so exhausted from all of the days walking, you can generally get to sleep ok however the cleaners woke us up early chatting loudly and banging around (none of the bedroom doors close quietly). The only good part is its location, in the centre of Rome. But honestly, that is it. I stay in lots of hotels with work and for leisure, and I can honestly say this is definitely not a 4 star and the worst hotel I have ever stayed in.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: ltpt
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel 2 nights out of the 9 we were in Rome. I had read in TA if you go to Rome only once pay for a view. It was expensive but the view and location were excellent. We had a deluxe room, which was HUGE. View not perfect but it was so much fun to see what was going on in the piazza. Had the worst night s sleep the whole time because it was SO noisy. But I would do it again. I can sleep at home! It was such a treat to see the piazza go from no one and quiet, to packed. Then to delivery trucks, garbage trucks going thru. During our stay there was a concert at the Pantheon which was wonderful to listen to sitting in bed with a glass of wine! The breakfast was the best I had. Wonderful assortment and all looked and tasted great. I wanted to try everything and kept getting my husband to take that to eat later. I didn't care if I was the piggy American! Staff was nice and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for our first visit to Rome”
Reviews.Author: needstraveladvice
Reviews.Content: This hotel was perfect for our family of four. Two rooms with one overlooking the Pantheon. The rooms are small, but who spends much time in the room in Rome? We walked to everything except the Vatican. Breakfast was not only beautifully presented but delicious. Even the coffee, American-style, was good. The desk was helpful with restaurant suggestions and the free internet access near the lobby was very helpful. The location alone makes this hotel worthy of high marks, but the atmosphere and service was perfect.

Reviews.Title: “What A Great Little Hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: TravelinTexanGal
Reviews.Content: A friend & I just returned from a 4 night stay at this marvelously quaint little hotel. We wanted something near all the attractions & something with lots of atmosphere & character. It is located directly across the piazza from the Pantheon & has been a hotel since the 1500's so it offered both those things. We had a twin bedded room which was small, but not cramped. I have stayed in a lot smaller hotel rooms in Europe. The people at the front desk were extremely friendly & helpful, the European style buffet breakfast was terrific, & the room was kept very clean. If you are looking for a ultra-modern, cookie cutter, chain type hotel, this is definitly not the one for you, but if you are looking for a real Roman experience you can't beat the Sole al Pantheon. Yes, it's pricey, but worth every penny. If I ever return to Rome this is where I'll stay!

Reviews.Title: “What a Location!”
Reviews.Author: fatcity
Reviews.Content: I found the Sole al Pantheon on the web. Our travel agent said not to book it and tried to get us to take a 5 star hotel near the train station. I booked it myself because of the location-ground zero in ancient Rome. We booked a two room apartment (for three) it was well appointed but no Piazza view. The hotel has a friendly staff, small bar and library, they also put out the best breakfast of our visit to Italy. Being on the piazza with the Pantheon was fantastic. Lots of people, nice dining and above all we were walking distance to all of the main attractions of Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Felt like in three star in Egypt!!!”
Reviews.Author: Yaroslav
Reviews.Content: Went only one night in this hotel for a romantic weekend in Rome. I booked two weeks prior to arrival. When we arrived, the hotel staff leaded us to the room that was smaller than my home bathroom! a tiny one-person bed, a shower (providing that all rooms should have jacuzzi according to the hotel information). When I asked for a normal room, the staff explained that they have all rooms booked and can only offer a different hotel! They are overbooking! How could a well-known hotel, asking for 400E per night have overbookings? The staff was helpless as in three star hotel in Egypt, only thing they could say was "sorry" and "excuse us". Horrible! spoiled all the vacations.

Reviews.Title: “Authentic experience”
Reviews.Author: coopereca
Reviews.Content: Albergo del Sole is without a doubt the oldest operating hotel in Rome, something like 600 years and counting. It is by no means luxurious or comfortable in the modern sense. However, the apartments that look over the Pantheon square offer something no other hotel in Rome can; a magical view into history. Late night and early morning the square is quiet and looking at the entrance to the Pantheon unobstructed is someting you can't buy. The top level apartment has a roof top deck of small porportion but overwhelming views. Rooms in the main building are long overdue for an update, but bathrooms are modern enough and paying more you would get a lot less. Breakfast for reasons I can't explain in the central courtyard of the main building are delightful. The slightly grumpy morning hostess has just the right touch with coffee or expresso drinks. The pastries are light as air and there is more breakfast here than at the best hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Not a 4 star hotel”
Reviews.Author: rtlcare
Reviews.Content: This hotel was recommended to us by some Italian friends who hadn't stayed there but knew it was next to the Pantheon, a great location, and had a 4star rating. In summary, don't go! The hotel is the oldest in Rome and it felt like it. Stained ceilings, holes in the floor, very, very small rooms, expensive and terrible service. The second half of our stay we changed hotels and stayed at the Albergo Hotel del Senato, next door. It was everything the the del Sole Pantheon was not.

Reviews.Title: “2nd time I stayed here”
Reviews.Author: AmFromDC
Reviews.Content: This was my 5th trip to Rome and the 2nd time I stayed at the hotel. I returned because primarily because of the location but also because the first stay was very pleasant - - charming room and friendly staff. Relative to other hotels in Rome, the price was not out of line. I find Rome hotels to be among the most expensive in Europe. My experience the second time was similar to the first. This time I stayed in Room 312, a small double, OK because I was by myself. Room overlooked the square and the Pantheon. No trouble with noise because the windows shut very tight. I am a light sleeper and it would have bothered me if I couldn't shut out the noise. Great breakfast. Friendly and helpful staff. Loved the jacuzzi in the bathroom. On the negative side, the room was showing some wear but it was very clean tho small. Relative to the Raphael, this was less expensive, MUCH friendlier, room about the same size, bkfst included. But make no mistake, you are paying for the location.

Reviews.Title: “Hot and Small”
Reviews.Author: Tina_Sparkles
Reviews.Content: The air conditioning did not work in either room and we did not sleep a wink all night. When we made a complaint to the front desk staff they did not apologize or offer a discount. It was kind of yucky and we would never stay there again. Rooms are too small even for Rome standards.

Reviews.Title: “Do NOT stay in the apartment!”
Reviews.Author: Clacy
Reviews.Content: I travelled with my young family and therefore was booked into the apartments across the Piazza from the main hotel. Yes, the room was huge. Yes, the view was amazing. Yes, the family enjoyed it. But......I was SO disappointed. The shower room was tiny, the water was tepid, the room smelt of damp. The rooms in the main hotel had jacuzzi batchs and I had a very poor, pathetic shower for the same price. When I stay in a four star hotel in a major European city that room is not what I expect - at all. Breakfast was ok. However the staff were excellent.... and Rome is pretty hot too!

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The hotel really is in a great location direct opposite the Pantheon. However, the hotel only has very few rooms which actually look on to the Piazza and, therefore, the Pantheon. On the first night we were put into room 102. The room had no window (except for a very small one in the bathroom), the room was very humid (and smelt that way), the bed had a huge water stain on it and the room had a glass door on to the breakfast terrace (in the morning we could, therefore, hear every word spoken on the breakfast terrace from our bed). After having complained about the first room we received another room on the third floor. Even though this room was a lot better than the first it wasn't worth the rate (EUR 400 per night). The AC hardly worked, small window and quite loud. The other part of our family stayed in a similar room. In the first morning they were woken by water dropping on to them. When they stood up to look what had happened it turned out that water was running down the walls. Although they told the concierge immediately nothing was done to help them and their complaints were ignored. I'm sure that there is better value for money than this hotel, even if the location is great.

Reviews.Title: “what a letdown”
Reviews.Author: MasterGee
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this property for one sleepless night in late January 2006 and wont ever go back. Don’t get me wrong, the hotel's location is great (it is in the same piazza as the pantheon). I was able to open my window and have a clear view of the pantheon's facade. The problems are that the decor is terribly outdated, the room is not comfortable, and the noise from the piazza is unbearable. I literally woke up 5 to 6 times throughout the night due to people singing, garbage cans being knocked over, and delivery trucks pulling into a nearby alley. The staff was friendly and, like I said, the location is great, but you can find better elsewhere. I moved to the Hotel Scalinata di Spagna and was very pleased.

Reviews.Title: “Bit of a disappointment”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: For the price, you would expect a fabulous hotel.. but you'll be disappointed. The Sole Al Pantheon is indeed in a fantastic location, but do not be fooled that this is a luxury hotel. We were given a nice room on arrival but there were very little comforts in the room. The mini-bar was not free (as per another reviewer's claims!), and the bathroom was tired to say the least. At night time we were kept awake for the first two nights by the noise from the piazza - both from revellers and the street cleaners who seemed to be up all night banging and crashing around. We then moved rooms and it was quieter, but very hot with not good AC. Some of the staff were lovely, others were aloof and disinterested - you could say rude! There is no room service and breakfast is basic and not necessarily that fresh. In summary, if you want a place to simply base yourself without any real luxury, this is for you - but be prepared to pay quite a lot of money for this privilege!

Reviews.Title: “so picturesque”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I travelled with my family in August of 2005 and stayed at this lovely hotel. Fabulous location - right off the piazza in front of the amazing Pantheon, with many restaurants and cafes in the piazza, and some great little osterias and trattorias just down the lane. The hotel was so picturesque, with the lovely breakfast area, open air, but with umbrellas for shade. Great breakfast, and great service from all the staff! Some of the rooms looked over the piazza, but we had no trouble with the noise, it was fine for sleeping. Because it is off the piazza, the taxi has to drop you off just around the corner - but the staff will come out to help with luggage. And you can always find your way back, just ask for the Pantheon!

Reviews.Title: “fabulous boutique hotel at great price Do Not Miss!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: If you want a unique hotel and experience, you must pick this hotel. Firstly, this is a small intimate boutique hotel with grand rooms from many centuries ago. Our lovely room was painted with frescoes on the ceiling and the shutters opened to reveal the most goregeous view of the Pantheon. The jacuzzi tub was a godsend after walking all day. Second, the location!!! You can walk to virtually anywhere- and we did. This is the first time I had been to Rome where I thought it was as easy to navigate as Florence. Thirdly, the food. My husband still talks about the sumptuous breakfast that was included in the price and the proscuitto de parma ham. The free internet is perfect for staying close to the family at home. There are charming private spots to read if you want to get out and the patio upstairs is lovely. This is a place for lovers and memories. DO NOT MISS!

Reviews.Title: “Loved this Hotel!!!!”
Reviews.Author: plandau
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in mid June after a horrible night at the Hotel Art (don't stay there!!!). The staff was extremely helpful in accomodating us. The A/C worked very well, the room was very clean and the location couldn't be better. We will certainly go back!!!!

Reviews.Title: “A huge disappointment”
Reviews.Author: FdeAsmundis
Reviews.Content: We spent two nights here just after Christmas 2004 and found the place well below our expectations. While the location is certainly a plus the standard for a 4-star hotel is totally unacceptable. The room was shabby, not particularly clean, and - adding to the disappointment - the hairdryer would shut down for overheating, the TV had to be replaced because not working properly and the water in the bathroom was barely lukewarm for our morning showers. Apparently they had to call an engineer to fix the boiler with the result not being satisfactory either. We had a first floor room and until midnight the voices of the staff chatting on the ground floor were so loud that we had to call reception for them to stop. To top it all whenever we reported a problem the attitude of the hotel staff was non committal to say the least - they never apologised for our inconvenience. This hotel is definetely on our personal black-list

Reviews.Title: “Not worth the price”
Reviews.Author: JS1Napoli_Italy
Reviews.Content: My husband and I recently stayed at the Albergo Del Sole Al Pantheon and we were quite disappointed and felt we certainly felt we did not get our money's worth. The room was small and quite hot for the beginning of April. The air conditioning did nothing to cool down the room and, as we overlooked the courtyard/breakfast room, we did not want to leave the windows open. We also found the desk staff a bit too aloof and not very helpful. We also had ants in our bathroom. We could have found the same quality of room in an equally good location for less money!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We just returned from Rome!! While there we stayed at Albergo Del Sole Al Pantheon and what a wonderful hotel! The location is the best and the staff were extremely helpful. Our room was just beautiful. We will definitely stay there again.

HotelInfo.Name: Albergo del Sole Al Pantheon
HotelInfo.Address: Piazza della Rotonda 63, 00186 Rome, Italy
